ca.ualberta.moodroid.ui

Class AddMoodDetail

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, androidx.activity.OnBackPressedDispatcherOwner, androidx.appcompat.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatCallback, androidx.core.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, androidx.core.app.ActivityCompat.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, androidx.core.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, androidx.core.view.KeyEventDispatcher.Component, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner

    public class AddMoodDetail
extends androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
    This activity follows immediately after AddMood. Once the User picks their emoji (which is always associated with a particular mood) they are brought to this activity where they then fill out the moods details. More information about what those details are below.

      protected void onActivityResult(int requestCode, int resultCode, android.content.Intent data)
      After choosing a photo from the library, this displays the image in the photoView field, and saves the path to the photo in the filePath variable.
      void onBackPressed()
      When the user presses the phone's back button before saving the moodEvent, delete the photo from Firestore.

      The initial UI is built here, using data from the last activity to dynamically display the mood colour, emoji, and title (this method may change).

      • mood

        final MoodEventRepository mood
        The mood repository is activated below.

      • moodEvent

        MoodEventModel moodEvent
        The mood event model is created below. This is essentially the frame for a mood event it is an object that stores all details filled out by the user in this activity, and is what the main mood feed in MoodHistory is made of.

        protected static java.lang.String[] situations

      • confirmBtn

        protected android.widget.Button confirmBtn
        The confirm button. when this button is clicked, it adds the mood to the firebase repository, and brings the user back to the activity MoodHistory.

      • photoView

        protected android.widget.ImageView photoView
        The Reason image.

        com.google.firebase.storage.StorageReference ref
        The Firestore storage reference.

        UI element, a tool used for picking dates. More specifically, used for picking the moods date.

        Same as above, but for time.

      • textWatcher

        android.text.TextWatcher textWatcher
        Checks for valid input for the reason_text field. If more than 3 words are entered, it will disable the confirm button.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        The initial UI is built here, using data from the last activity to dynamically display the mood colour, emoji, and title (this method may change). the rest of the UI is made below, where the user is prompted to fill in all of the details of a mood event which were explained in the variables above.
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState -

      • onActivityResult

        protected void onActivityResult(int requestCode,
                                int resultCode,
                                @Nullable
                                android.content.Intent data)
        After choosing a photo from the library, this displays the image in the photoView field, and saves the path to the photo in the filePath variable. After adding a location this will display remove location button and get rid of add location button it will also turn the lat and lon to a geopoint
        Overrides:
        onActivityResult in class androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity

      • uploadPhoto

        private void uploadPhoto()
        This uploads the photo the user picked from their library to the firebase storage.

      • onBackPressed

        public void onBackPressed()
        When the user presses the phone's back button before saving the moodEvent, delete the photo from Firestore.

        onBackPressed in class androidx.activity.ComponentActivity
